sessions.title: Keynote
sessions.description: Google I/O's much-anticipated kickoff event will make you among the first developers to see what we've been working on here at Google. If you're not joining us at Moscone, grab some popcorn, kick back and enjoy the show directly from your Android powered device.

sessions.title: Anyone can do it! Easy ways to evaluate your App’s Accessibility
sessions.description: One in 5 people in the U.S. will have a disability in their lives. They want to be productive, creative and of course -- use your app. Technology has made more experiences, connections, and products available to people with disabilities but there is still room for improvement. With our talk we will help you to understand the experience of your app from the perspective of a user with accessibility needs. We will share best practices, pitfalls, and a step by step guide on how to use easy UX research techniques to improve the accessibility of your application.

sessions.title: Finding success with family-friendly apps on Play
sessions.description: Insights into the secrets of success for family-friendly apps and games on Google Play. Get practical tips directly from top partners to help you boost your reach, retention and revenue.

sessions.title: Help your users live better with Google Fit
sessions.description: Google Fit is creating and unsiloing fitness data for millions of users globally - whether they are elite athletes or just people battling everyday lack of motivation. As a fitness developer, how can you use this data to help people lead fuller lives? What kind of data is it and how are we generating it? The Google Fit team reveals all in this talk.

sessions.title: Improving urban mobility by connecting citizens
sessions.description: Waze launched the Connected Citizens Program in October 2014 with 10 cities around the world. Now, at 30 cities, law enforcement and Departments of Transportation, we have data on the impact of massively crowdsourced data on our traffic patterns. We’ll share case studies and look at the real ways they’re improving their cities to meet citizen expectations in a mobile world.

sessions.title: Notifications, Interruptions, & Volumes: Coming Attractions
sessions.description: In Lollipop, you witnessed a huge evolution in Android's notifications. They're more accessible and robust than ever before. But there's a flip side: more competition for users' attention. So Lollipop also introduced ways for users to control unwelcome interruptions from notifications and other sources. Since then, we've been hard at work refining these features for the M release. Come get the inside scoop on what's new and what it means for your app.

sessions.title: Polymer n00b.
sessions.description: Polymer n00b. Hands-on with Polymer 1.0: Intro to Polymer 1.0 and thinking in components

sessions.title: Smarter approaches to app testing
sessions.description: One of the reasons over a billion users love Android is that they get to pick the device that's just right for them. This can make it harder to test on all of your users’ devices before release. Apps that are tested thoroughly get better reviews and make more money (fact!). We're here to help – hear about the new ways Google can help maximize the success of your next app launch with cheaper and easier testing strategies.

sessions.title: Understanding your users on mobile apps with Google Analytics
sessions.description: With app discoverability being an issue, more and more developers rely on app promotion to get their app in the hands of users. With hundreds of networks to choose from, it can be difficult to keep track of and manage it all. However, with Google, you can stay on top of your app install attribution needs. In this session, we will cover how you can get started configuring campaign setup, determining where your installs came from, and sending those conversions back to the ad networks (postbacks) to optimize on them. We will also cover how you can measure the effectiveness of your marketing campaigns.

sessions.title: Video chat for Web, iOS and Android
sessions.description: WebRTC enables realtime audio, video and data communication on billions of clients across Web, Android and iOS. In this talk, you will learn how to build a high performance, cross-platform voice and video chat application.

sessions.title: Accessible Web Components
sessions.description: “You should be writing accessible Web Components, but are you really?” Cover why a11y is so extremely important for Web Components. Go over a11y checklist and implement a few elements live.

sessions.title: Apps for kids and families: Get discovered
sessions.description: Do you create apps that broaden the mind and inspire creativity among kids and families? Then join us to learn about the new family-friendly discovery experience on Google Play, and how we’re making it easier for parents to discover your age-appropriate content. We’ll go over best practices for developing apps for families, review the eligibility requirements and opt-in process for the new Designed for Families developer program, and demo the new consumer-facing experience.

sessions.title: Containers to back your mobile app
sessions.description: Your mobile backend APIs need to be simple, reliable, and ready to scale when your usebase does. In this talk we'll walk you through setting up very flexible API using containers on Google Cloud Platform.

sessions.title: Gaming on Android TV
sessions.description: Android is in the living room, through Android TV. Players are finding that their familiar consumer electronics devices, from cable boxes, to media players, to televisions, now give them easy access to great games. With the Nearby Connections API we introduced at GDC, developers can now bring second screen experiences to Android TV too. This talk discusses how to easily adapt games to Android TV.

sessions.title: Introduction to high-performance NDK Audio
sessions.description: Android is now ready for serious audio and music applications. This session will introduce creating high-performance, low-latency audio generation applications in C/C++ with the Android NDK. We will cover creating an NDK application project in Eclipse, OpenSL ES audio playback and an architecture for audio synthesis applications.

sessions.title: Promote your mobile app in minutes
sessions.description: Promote your app directly from the Google Play Developer Console. In a matter of minutes, launch a campaign that reaches users across Google Search, AdMob, Play, YouTube, and more. Come by this session to learn tips on developing creatives, bidding and reporting to maximize reach and engagement for your apps.

sessions.title: Your app, now available hands-free
sessions.description:
Mobile hardware has adopted the touch screen as the primary mode of input. And with 1 billion active Android users, there’s no sign of this slowing down.

What if you could provide users with a new method of access to your apps with little to no development overhead?

In this talk, we introduce Voice Access, a service that gives anyone access to their Android device through voice alone. We will focus on simple steps developers can follow to ensure that Voice Access provides an optimal experience within their apps.

sessions.title: reCAPTCHA: Tough on bots, Easy on Humans, Great on Mobile
sessions.description:
CAPTCHAs are an integral part of fighting spam on the internet. Google’s reCAPTCHA is the largest CAPTCHA service in the world. With the shift to mobile, there is an increasing need to fight spam in that space. However, traditional CAPTCHAs are not well suited for mobile form factors. In response, the reCAPTCHA team recently launched a completely reimagined API that lets users pass the CAPTCHA test with just a single click. This “No CAPTCHA reCAPTCHA” dramatically simplifies the mobile user experience.

In this talk we will discuss the technology behind the magic “No CAPTCHA” followed by an interactive codelab to implement reCAPTCHA on your mobile site.

sessions.title: Google Cloud Messaging 3.0
sessions.description: The next big things from Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) that simplify your mobile messaging solution, enabling you to focus more on your core offering to your end users.

sessions.title: What's new in Android
sessions.description: This session will highlight the most exciting new developer features of the Android platform.

sessions.title: Code Labs
sessions.description: Learn from Google experts about how to setup your own development environment.

sessions.title: Achieving Maps zen on Android
sessions.description: Do your maps look the same as everyone elses? Is your user experience a bit ho hum? Android maps veterans Chris and Ankur will enlighten you on the zen patterns that bring maps feng shui to your Android apps.

sessions.title: Applying Wear design patterns
sessions.description: A very detailed and thorough look at the new Material Design patterns for Android Wear apps: When should you be an app versus a notification or contextual card? What patterns are right for what tasks/apps? How to mix and match?

sessions.title: Battery Performance & Tooling
sessions.description:
Battery is the most precious resource to Android users right now. The world is more mobile, but it’s frustrating when you can’t make it through a full day without needing to recharge your phone. And Sadly, for most developers, Battery Efficiency is the last thing on their minds.

In this talk , we will introduce the basic concepts of Battery Performance on android, some tools to help you find problems, and point out a few simple pitfalls to avoid while writing your application.

sessions.title: Build mobile apps and cloud services using gRPC
sessions.description: Engineering teams at Google use RPCs extensively to build cloud and mobile applications. We have recently open-sourced gRPC - our new open-source RPC library. The engineering lead for gRPC will provide an introduction to key features and concepts and a demonstration of how gRPC enables faster development velocity by handling a number of networking, security and systems issues. Specific benefits for projects building mobile applications or cloud backend services will be covered. This talk should be of interest to developers and technology leaders that design the technology stack for their projects.

sessions.title: Building a successful subscription business on Google Play
sessions.description: More and more developers are building subscription-based businesses on Google Play, with consumer spend on such services surging drastically. To support the growing supply and demand of subscription offerings, Google Play’s billing platform has been innovating on critical product features to help developers acquire, convert, bill, and retain users. This talk introduces the opportunities (and challenges) of launching a direct-to-consumer subscription service, highlights how Google Play can help, and shares learnings from successful video, music, news, dating, and sports apps.

sessions.title: Deep Dive: Notifications API
sessions.description: Deep Dive: Notifications API

sessions.title: Google Classroom demo
sessions.description: Check out what's possible with Google Classroom, which launched a year ago and is being used by millions of teachers and students.

sessions.title: Mobile app quality leaps to the cloud
sessions.description:
See how you can improve your app’s ratings by testing early, broader and often. With nearly unlimited resources of the cloud and significant automation, this is achievable for even the most constrained app development teams. 
Want to access the latest (and old) Android and iOS devices that your app might need to run on? Wish you could run hundreds of tests in parallel on every combination for every commit? Want to improve quality without even writing tests? Join us to see how all three can be achieved. We will use a Google Cloud test service to illustrate some of the key practices that you can incorporate in your app development.

sessions.title: One tap, all the points: A smart take on loyalty
sessions.description: Many in-store transactions include loyalty cards, gift cards and coupons. Merchants can implement our SmartTap specification, making it a snap for people to use their loyalty cards by simply tapping at the point-of-sale terminal. We’ll also discuss an open API that enables merchants to drive customer engagement with loyalty cards, gift cards, and coupons in their mobile wallet.

sessions.title: Optimize your app presence on Google Search with Search Console
sessions.description: The shiny, new Search Console provides app owners with information about how their indexed apps are performing in Google Search. This hands-on session will show a live demo of how an application can be added to Google Search using the error reporting and analytics in the Search Console.

sessions.title: Apps installing channels on TVs
sessions.description: Box talk for Android TV engineering team to showcase/explain/workshop the concept of apps being able to install channels on TVs and how it fits into the TV scheme. We'd probably have engineering explain how to go about building/implmenting at a high-level.

sessions.title: Building location aware apps using the Android Location and Places APIs
sessions.description: When we talk about meeting up for lunch, we don’t think of location as latitude and longitude - we think of a place, like a restaurant or cafe. The Places API makes using location in Android more powerful by providing APIs to accurately determine and communicate about the place or semantic location that a device is currently at, powered by Google's best in class local business data. This talk introduces the new features available for representing location as part of the API, and the practical applications of this API.

sessions.title: Building voice actions for your Android app
sessions.description: Learn how to drive traffic to your Android app using voice actions powered by Google. This talk will cover how apps can leverage Google's natural language processing and semantic understanding to implement voice actions, on phones, tablets, and watches.

sessions.title: Calendar talk
sessions.description: NEEDED

sessions.title: Designing for Driving
sessions.description: Android Auto was developed to take features and apps from your phone and deliver them in a responsible manner for use in your car. This is a challenging process and there’s a lot of research and reason that goes into every part the interface in order to help minimize driver distraction. This talk steps through some of the work that Google does to drive the design of Android Auto.

sessions.title: Designing for Google Cast
sessions.description: Google Cast has quickly accelerated past 1.5 Billion casts, and is now the best way to bring your mobile app to TV and audio devices. The lead designer of Chromecast will talk about what it takes to “cast-ify” your app, and to take advantage of the latest updates to the cast model for multi-screen interactions, shared queues, sound systems, and games, all using the mobile phone as the controller. This talk is for developers and designers who want to extend their mobile and web apps to TVs and speakers.

sessions.title: Leanback support library
sessions.description: Android TV presents unique opportunities for developers to create a living room presence for their applications and services. Delivering a delightful experience for TVs requires consideration of distance, form factor, and input, but it doesn't have to be difficult! Come learn about the Leanback support library, designed for rapid development of TV UX through customizable fragments and templates. We will present a broad overview of features, and highlight upcoming visual changes and new features.

sessions.title: Make Believe
sessions.description: Join us to explore virtual reality and how it may change our lives. Learn how it works and how to design virtual reality experiences. Includes lessons learnt from virtual reality game developer Katie Goode.

sessions.title: Smarter and personalized device authentication with Smart Lock
sessions.description: Join us to learn how we’ve made Android even smarter so you can securely and conveniently keep your phone unlocked using a new set of exciting technologies from biometrics to wearables. If you’re a wearable manufacturer, find out how you can make your wearable compatible.

sessions.title: What's new in the Google Play Developer Console
sessions.description: Google Play’s new launches will help you acquire more users and improve the quality of your app. Come and hear an overview of the latest features and how you can start taking advantage of them in the Developer Console.

sessions.title: Smarter monetization with AdMob and Analytics
sessions.description: Mobile development is growing more and more complex. To make things easier for publishers, we have created a smart mobile ads platform that goes beyond the traditional ad server. Come listen to Jonathan Alferness talk about how AdMob brings the power, scale and innovation to app developers who want to monetize effectively through tools like ad mediation for higher fill rates, new formats like native ads, and Audience builder with Google Analytics for list building and targeting. In this talk, we will also be unveiling some new features that will help make things simpler for developers.

sessions.title: What’s New in Android Development Tools
sessions.description: In this session we will provide an in depth tour of the Android development tools and take a closer look at everything new - along with tips and tricks for getting the most out of them!

sessions.title: AdMob Cross-platform Showdown
sessions.description: It's an epic battle between two AdMob engineers, one on Android and one on iOS! They will battle for the title of Fastest Ad in the West as they live code their way into stardom. Join our mystery celebrity host and their swag cannon to an action packed coding session.

sessions.title: Android for Work Update
sessions.description: Android M is bringing the power of Android to all kinds of workplaces. This opens huge new markets for hundreds of millions of devices to workers at small business, deskless workers, logistics and warehousing jobs; all be empowered by adoption of Android devices at Work.

sessions.title: App discovery on Google Play
sessions.description: We've made progress over the last year towards better personalization on Play’s homepages, via innovative user experiences and advanced technologies such as Google Brain and Google-scale distributed machine learning. In this talk, we provide an overview of how we model user tastes and interests, how we recommend apps and games you will love, and how to occasionally take educated guesses on content we've never shown you before. We also talk about new immersive experiences that’ll help the user engage with the store as a habit and hence discover more apps.

sessions.title: Data driven Android UI development
sessions.description: Writing Android UI is developer intensive and keeping it up to date with data changes is not trivial. We will demonstrate an easy and robust way to develop a rich, responsive, data-driven Android application with minimal code and effort.

sessions.title: Optimizing your game’s first impression on Play
sessions.description: Google Play offers developers an incredible opportunity to reach more than 1 billion people in 190 countries. App discovery and distribution play a critical role in driving developers’ success. Learn from the Dots team on how they leveraged Google Play’s features to optimize their visual assets for increased discovery and distribution of their games.

sessions.title: Simplifying app development using the wearable support library
sessions.description: The wearable support library provides extra functionality used by Android Wear developers to develop great wearable experiences. It includes common user interface components that developers can use to support round and square watches, notification cards, long press to dismiss, countdowns, confirmations, 2D pickers, and selection lists. Come to the talk to find out more about how to use the wearable support library, and how you can use it to simplify your Android Wear development.

sessions.title: The Physical Web: Interaction is Just a Tap Away
sessions.description:
If we believe in Moore's Law whatsoever, then small, cheap, connected devices will soon explode into our lives, filling our homes, workplaces, and public spaces. Today, most IoT devices require installing a dedicated app, which simply doesn't scale when you want to interact with a multitude of smart “things” around you every day.

The web is a natural fit, offering interaction on demand without the friction and overhead of installation. This talk introduces the Physical Web, a technology that lets you walk up and use anything with just a tap.

sessions.title: The world as a dataset
sessions.description: Satellite imagery has the potential to be a powerful tool for global business analytics and global transparency. However, the vast majority of high-resolution imagery today is updated infrequently. What if it were updated weekly? Daily? Recent and timely data could be used by analysts, operational managers, data scientists, and developers to increase the efficiency, profitability, safety, and transparency of organizations around the world. Take a look under the hood at Skybox to find out what we're building for your business and get a preview of a new breed of dataset.

sessions.title: Using Ambiactive in wearable apps
sessions.description: Ambiactive (ambient-active) is a new feature of the Android Wear platform that allows long-running applications to control the entire screen in low-power ambient mode (with a lower refresh rate, in black and white). Previously, when the watch entered low-power mode, it returned to the home screen, exiting the currently running application. In this talk we will describe how to update the long-running activities in your application to implement ambiactive mode to preserve application state and continually present ongoing updates, while conserving battery.

sessions.title: What's next with Project Tango?
sessions.description: It's been almost a year since we unveiled Project Tango. If you are a mobile developer interested in creating location-aware and spatial experiences, come learn about the new tools we've created for you and see what our partners have built. Get a sneak peak at how Project Tango will help users connect the virtual world with the real world. Join us on our journey!

sessions.title: Building a real-time app in 5 minutes with Firebase
sessions.description: Learn about Firebase, and how to build a real time chat room in 5 minutes. But there is much more - we’ll look into some common patterns when building real time games, such as authentication, online presence detection, game room, and sharing game state.

sessions.title: Expressing brand in Material
sessions.description: Anyone should be able to incorporate the material design framework while maintaining a strong brand identity. Whether it’s a custom font, a unique color story, or distinct voice, everything that provides stylistic distinction in a product should be celebrated and supported in the material design framework. We’ve laid out the top brand touchpoints to consider illustrate the system’s flexibility and give designers and developers a road map for showcasing their brand identity.

sessions.title: Finding your way with the Google Maps SDK for iOS
sessions.description: Have you ever wanted your users to be able to share where they are with each other, or where they want to go? The Google Maps SDK for iOS, with the addition of Places API for iOS, enables your users to find that perfect Sushi place or a cozy coffee shop with confidence. The Google Places API brings the power of one of the most comprehensive locations databases to your app, and the Google Maps SDK for iOS puts effortless geographic visualisation in the palm of your hand.

sessions.title: M APIs for app payments and fingerprints
sessions.description: Numerous new APIs for app payments and fingerprint integration are being introduced in M. This will enable enhanced UX and security for retail payments, banking and online purchasing. We will also have partners integrated with these new capabilities that we want to highlight at IO.

sessions.title: Making great products for education
sessions.description: No one needs great technology more than educators, yet schools are littered with technology that doesn’t get used. This hands-on workshop from the team that built Google Classroom will give you a chance to try out lightweight prototyping and user testing techniques that are key to making great products -- and having a big impact in education.

sessions.title: New monetization opportunities in Google Play for Education
sessions.description: Google Play for Education offers developers a channel for reaching schools using Android tablets and Chromebooks. Learn how Google is making it easier for schools to discover and evaluate great digital content and how you can build apps that support new monetization mechanisms through Google Play for Education.

sessions.title: Performance on RAILs
sessions.description: Looking around at web performance advice today can be overwhelming: everything comes with caveats, disclaimers, and sometimes one piece of advice can seem to actively contradict another. Phrases like “the DOM is slow” or “always use CSS animations!” make for great headlines, but the truth is often far more nuanced. In this session we'll look at how to think holistically about performance, and how to prioritize optimization work that your users will notice and appreciate.

sessions.title: Polymer n00b.
sessions.description: Polymer n00b. Hands-on with Polymer 1.0: Intro to Polymer 1.0 and thinking in components

sessions.title: Rendering Performance & Tooling
sessions.description:
Rendering performance is all about how fast you can draw your activity, and get it updated on the screen. Success here means your users feeling like your application is smooth and responsive, which means that you’ve got to get all your logic completed, _and_ all your rendering done in 16ms or less, each and every frame. But that might be a bit more difficult than you think.

In this talk,we will take a look at what “rendering performance” means, alongside some of the most common pitfalls that are ran into; and let’s not forget the important stuff: the tools that help you track down, and fix these issues before they become large problems.

sessions.title: Using the Fitness platform on wearable devices
sessions.description: We'd like to demonstrate how to use the Google Fitness platform APIs to read activity history and write activity sessions, with a particular focus on wearable devices: displaying step counts, fitness goals, and progress on a watch face, and recording exercise activities on a wearable.

sessions.title: Google Core: An overview
sessions.description: Google Core brings all the power of Google to Android and iOS. With over two billion devices, the key services you need, and the key features your users want are all available to you. And now with the improved developer experience, getting them into your project is a breeze.

sessions.title: Making apps context aware: Opportunities, tools, lessons and the future
sessions.description: Are we as developers taking full advantage of the new sensing capabilities (like GPS, Bluetooth Low Energy, accelerometers, barometers) of mobile devices to make user experiences delightful? These new sensors introduce the capability to know where a person is and what they’re doing as well as many other clues. Join us as we explore the opportunities, show some old and new tools Google has created to help, share our lessons building experiences like the Now “Where did I park my car?” card, and predict what the future may hold for context-aware computing.

sessions.title: The next generation mobile web
sessions.description: The mobile web empowers users to easily navigate through a rich diversity of secure experiences. But until now, developers had to choose between the engagement potential of a native app and the reach potential of the mobile web. Performance improvements, offline support, and access to new device capabilities such as notifications and promoted add to homescreen allow developers to deliver more meaningful experiences to the web than ever before. Join us as we talk about the future of the mobile web!

sessions.title: Deep Dive: Overview Cards API
sessions.description: Deep Dive: Overview Cards API

sessions.title: Espresso
sessions.description:
The Espresso testing framework, part of the Android Testing Support Library, provides APIs for writing UI tests to simulate user interactions with your target app. 

In this talk we build on top of the basics covered in the Android Testing Support Library overview and covers advanced topics like interactions with list views, validation of intents and the new WebView API.

sessions.title: Get your app into the Google index
sessions.description: Learn the steps involved in making sure a mobile app can be indexed by Google and appear in Google Search results and Search autocompletions. This talk will show how App Indexing can help you get new users, drive re-engagement, and measure the results.

sessions.title: Making your apps work smarter: Introducing Google’s beacon platform and Eddystone, a new open beacon format
sessions.description:
No omnipresent tool in history has ever had as much computing power or as many sensors as the modern smartphone. Yet, we’re still struggling to harness and contextualize this opportunity into more intuitive interactions: why doesn’t my transit app automatically detect my current stop? Why doesn’t my fitness app understand I was on a stationary bike?

Join us to hear how we’re beginning to use beacons to enable smarter interactions based on precise context: expanding the conversation from inferring context to creating context, and from mapping the world to marking it up. This talk introduces Google’s beacon platform, and Eddystone, a new open BLE beacon format, designed to make beacon development and deployment easier for everyone.

sessions.title: Material Design Year One
sessions.description: Lessons from the first year of material design.

sessions.title: Material Design on iOS + web: Engineering across platforms
sessions.description: Engineering material design across platforms.

sessions.title: Memory Performance & Tooling
sessions.description:
What’s great about Android’s runtime that most of the stress of memory reclamation is done for you; The system will track what you’re doing, and when it sees an object isn’t needed any more, will free it on your behalf. While this is great for your general health, and blood pressure, this doesn’t exclude performance problems from happening here.

In this talk, we will walk through how the Android memory system works, and identifies some common perf problems, and introduce you to tools to help track down and solve the issues.

sessions.title: Midnight Train & Chrome Dev Tools
sessions.description: Come learn about all the amazing advances in Chrome's developer tools.

sessions.title: Mobilizing the Maps Data APIs
sessions.description: Geo web services let developers create compelling location based apps on mobile, such as snapping your car’s location to roads, auto-completing an address, or displaying directions from A to B on a map. This talk will tackle several challenges that developers face in working with web services for mobile, in particular key security, how to share context between different APIs and conserving battery life.

sessions.title: Video actions and movie reviews
sessions.description: Learn how to get your video content and reviews surfaced in Google Search on mobile. This talk will cover website annotation and app deep linking.

sessions.title: Introduction to Coursebuilder
sessions.description: This talk will provide an overview of the Coursebuilder system, which is a tool for making online courses that runs on AppEngine. Join us as we describe how to make use of AppEngine at scale, how to manage identity, security and privacy, and how to integrate Big Query and MapReduce jobs to do data analytics.

sessions.title: Kickstart your web app with Web Starter Kit
sessions.description: Learn how to get your web app up and running fast with Web Starter Kit and how it keeps your site lean and mean.

sessions.title: Working with Nest to build a thoughtful home together
sessions.description: For years, we’ve been talking about home automation. There are universal remotes, wall panels and apps to control devices in your home. But Works with Nest is more than just an on/off switch. It’s about making your house a more thoughtful home, working securely behind the scenes to interact with things you already use every day. And, as a result, making your home safer, more energy efficient, and more aware. Learn more about the Works with Nest developer program and join us in making this vision become reality.

sessions.title: Android Pay: The next generation of payments on Android
sessions.description:
Consumers are increasingly paying on their Android devices for goods and services. We’re also seeing nascent but growing use of Android devices for in-store payments. Both trends are expected to accelerate rapidly. 

Google is launching Android Pay, a simple and secure way to pay in-store and in-app with your Android device. Android Pay is also an open API that approved developers can use to add payments to their own Android apps. In this session, we’ll showcase Android Pay and other innovative payments solutions. We’ll also discuss opportunities for developers to innovate with us on mobile payments at Android scale.

sessions.title: Growing games with Google
sessions.description: The games industry has never been more promising and full of opportunities. In addition to consoles, PC and browser gaming, phone and tablet games, there are emerging fields including virtual reality and mobile games in the living room. This talk covers how Google is helping developers across this broad range of platforms.

sessions.title: Material Now
sessions.description:
A look at where we’ve been and where we’re going with material design. 

This talk will examine the logistics of materializing products inside and outside of Google over the past year, from working collaboratively with product teams, to expanding and refining our guidelines for designers and developers. It will ask: how can we push material design into new and exciting territory?

sessions.title: Android Battery Life
sessions.description: Battery life is #1 problem in Mobile. Objectives: Developers understand the collective problem; Developers understand the tools available to characterize the battery impact of their apps; Developers understand the features in Android to help with battery life; Developers understand the new battery related platform behaviors that will affect their apps

sessions.title: Optimizing graphics memory bandwidth on mobile GPUs
sessions.description: High-quality graphics rendering can help your game stand out and keep players immersed and engaged. But particularly on mobile devices, performance of advanced multi-pass techniques like deferred shading or post-processing are usually limited by bandwidth. This talk demonstrates how to use new features coming to Android's native graphics API to keep intermediate data in fast on-chip memory between passes, saving valuable bandwidth and power while increasing performance.

sessions.title: Permissions model for new applications
sessions.description: Android M is going to change the Permissions model for new applications. This is the first change to how Android deals with permissions since its inception. Developers need to understand what's changing, how it impacts them, and how to continue giving users a great experience while maintaining privacy.

sessions.title: After Hours
sessions.description: Registered attendees are invited to mingle with devs, enjoy great food and listen to some tunes with us After Hours. Conference credentials are required for entry.

sessions.title: Activity Recognition: Use low power sensors to detect user activity
sessions.description: There are over a billion Android devices in the world, and they’re packed with sensors. Android Activity Recognition fuses this sensor data together to provide a simple, low-power interface for apps to understand what users are doing. In this talk, we provide an overview of the Activity Recognition APIs, an introduction to new functionality that we've introduced, and talk through some interesting sample applications.

sessions.title: Adaptive Material Design
sessions.description: Responsive app templates: How do you take a material app and extend it naturally across radically differing screen sizes? Talk would address web, mobile -- and even Auto.

sessions.title: Android Pay for mCommerce
sessions.description: Come learn more about how you can build Android Pay into your app to drive faster checkouts and higher conversions. You’ll also hear about all the great apps and developers that are integrating with Android Pay and how we’ve partnered with the ecosystem to make integration a breeze.

sessions.title: Android application architecture
sessions.description: Android is a large, rich platform with many capabilities, but a potentially overwhelming set of choices for any set of problems. This session will cover patterns, best practices, and architecture for solid, well-performing, and robustly structured Android applications.

sessions.title: Building voice actions for your Android app
sessions.description: Learn how to drive traffic to your Android app using voice actions powered by Google. This talk will cover how apps can leverage Google's natural language processing and semantic understanding to implement voice actions, on phones, tablets, and watches.

sessions.title: Designing games for Google Cast
sessions.description: This inspirational and informative talk will describe the game design patterns and UX principles for delivering great games for Chromecast and other Cast devices. Topics will include choosing the best Google Cast technology for your game such as the Game Manager APIs or Remote Display for Google Cast, designing for the mobile and television experience on multiple screens, and adapting existing game design patterns to a multi-screen interactive format.

sessions.title: Optimize your app presence on Google Search with Search Console
sessions.description: The shiny, new Search Console provides app owners with information about how their indexed apps are performing in Google Search. This hands-on session will show a live demo of how an application can be added to Google Search using the error reporting and analytics in the Search Console.

sessions.title: Real-time analytics for mobile and IoT
sessions.description: Why wait to analyze data which is continuously arriving? See how to use Google Cloud Dataflow, a flexible, fully-managed, and easy-to-use, stream processing service to get insight from your logs, sensor readings or other streaming data in real time.

sessions.title: Security Key: Make your login unphishable
sessions.description: Security Key is an inexpensive 2nd factor device which provides the user unphishable security for Google logins and for any other website which implements support. The user carries one device which works across all sites which support the open FIDO U2F protocol. We will talk about how to set yourself up on your Google login and also how you can enable support on any other website.

sessions.title: Security talk
sessions.description: NEEDED

sessions.title: Unit testing on Android
sessions.description:
Unit tests are fundamental to a robust app testing strategy. Writing unit tests helps you to quickly catch and fix software regressions introduced by code changes to your app.

In this talk we'll go through the new unit testing support in Android Studio and Gradle, looking at code samples and common scenarios.

sessions.title: Acquire and engage audiences with AdWords, App Indexing and Google Analytics
sessions.description: Content discovery on mobile is not easy. Luckily, this is a familiar problem to Google. With App Indexing, you can acquire and engage users organically by surfacing your app content in the search results page, whether or not users have your app installed. And with Google’s smart mobile ads platform, you have access to the largest network in the world through AdWords to find the right users who will install and engage with your app, plus you can gain insight with install attribution to know where your users came from with Google Analytics. Learn about all the ways that Google can help you drive discovery, growth and engagement with your mobile apps in this session.

sessions.title: Polymer and modern web APIs: In production at Google scale
sessions.description: The latest version of Polymer is fast and lean. With new elements and tools, Polymer 1.0 is ready for production. Learn how teams at Google have successfully launched on google.com using Polymer and the latest platform APIs: Web Animations, Service Workers for offline and push notifications, and material design. Last but not least, we’ll show you how to leverage the same tools as Google to be successful using Polymer Starter Kit - a new toolkit for building mobile-first apps.

sessions.title: Badass and beautiful. Tech and human. Love and work. ATAP.
sessions.description:
Optimized for speed. Because we are, well, impatient. And someone should be.  
 
The engines on Project Ara are revved.  We’re on the road to Puerto Rico. Creating the hardware equivalent of the software app ecosystem sometimes feels a little Dakar Rally, sometimes a little Le Mans. Fast. Difficult. Worth it.
  
Speaking of fast… We’ll debut our newest Spotlight Story ‘Fast-and-Furious’ style. Justin Lin’s live action short goes live at I/O. In full 360 with 3D soundsphere. Whaaaat? Exactly.   
 
And wearables that we hope will blow your socks off. (We mean this more literally than you might think…) Our goal: break the tension between the ever-shrinking screen sizes necessary to make electronics wearable and our ability to have rich interactions with them. Why can’t you have both?  
 
We like to build new things. Sometimes seemingly impossible things. We can build them faster together.

sessions.title: Code Labs
sessions.description: Learn from Google experts about how to setup your own development environment.

sessions.title: A preview of what’s in-store for payments
sessions.description: Come join us and get a sneak peak into what we’re working on for in-store payments, where your identity and phone work in tandem to deliver a seamless payment experience.

sessions.title: Bringing Material Design to life on Android
sessions.description: With a new visual design and new user interface patterns, material design has strongly impacted how Android apps look and act. Yet, you don't want to spend time building common material design components: that’s time that could be spent making your app stand out. Learn the story behind the key material design components, why they are important to your app, and how Google is helping bring consistent, easy to use material design components to all developers.

sessions.title: Building a successful subscription business on Google Play
sessions.description: More and more developers are building subscription-based businesses on Google Play, with consumer spend on such services surging drastically. To support the growing supply and demand of subscription offerings, Google Play’s billing platform has been innovating on critical product features to help developers acquire, convert, bill, and retain users. This talk introduces the opportunities (and challenges) of launching a direct-to-consumer subscription service, highlights how Google Play can help, and shares learnings from successful video, music, news, dating, and sports apps.

sessions.title: Building on Gmail and Inbox
sessions.description: Building on Gmail and Inbox. Showcasing the capabilities of the Gmail API (including publish and subscribe notifications which will be new), the Reminders API, SmartMail and upcoming Inbox extensibility. Talk will include examples of great extensions and apps that have been built using the APIs, a highlighting of what's new in Inbox, and how developers can take advantage on both mobile and web.

sessions.title: Game Manager APIs for Google Cast
sessions.description: There are millions of Chromecasts in living rooms around the globe, ready for your amazing multiplayer game. Join us and discover how you can use the Game Manager APIs for Google Cast to focus on what you do best: creating compelling games for the living room using Android and iOS mobile devices as game controllers to unleash new interaction models for Chromecast and other Cast devices.

sessions.title: Google’s suite of identity solutions for third parties
sessions.description: Auth can be complicated, but getting it right doesn’t have to be. Learn about identity tools from Google that can help you quickly build an auth system that will grow with your business and reduce the friction of getting users into your app.

sessions.title: Grow your app via word of mouth
sessions.description: The leading problem app developers face is to get users to discover their app in an extraordinarily competitive and crowded market. In this talk, we will present best practices for developers to drive organic growth via word-of-mouth, and how Google can help them.

sessions.title: Integrating search across Android TV
sessions.description: Android TV depends on partners to integrate their content search into Google's search to present to users who has what content (i.e. where cna I watch "Godzilla"? which app? Where is it cheapest?) This box talk would be presentation/q&a/codelab to get people started on this integration.

sessions.title: Material Design Year One
sessions.description: Lessons from the first year of material design.

sessions.title: One tap, all the points: A smart take on loyalty
sessions.description: Many in-store transactions include loyalty cards, gift cards and coupons. Merchants can implement our SmartTap specification, making it a snap for people to use their loyalty cards by simply tapping at the point-of-sale terminal. We’ll also discuss an open API that enables merchants to drive customer engagement with loyalty cards, gift cards, and coupons in their mobile wallet.

sessions.title: Android Developer Tools: Deep dive into Performance & Build Tools
sessions.description: Having the right developer tools can make it easier to build Android apps for multiple build targets or improve the performance of an app. This talk is a deep dive on the latest developments on in Performance & Build Tools in Android Studio.

sessions.title: Android Testing Support Library
sessions.description: The Android Testing Support Library is a collection of tools for testing Android apps. This talk will introduce key parts of ATSL (namely test runner and rules, as well as Espresso) and demonstrate how they can be used to author and execute a set of simple tests that can run in a device or an emulator.

sessions.title: Anyone can do it! Easy ways to evaluate your App’s Accessibility
sessions.description: One in 5 people in the U.S. will have a disability in their lives. They want to be productive, creative and of course -- use your app. Technology has made more experiences, connections, and products available to people with disabilities but there is still room for improvement. With our talk we will help you to understand the experience of your app from the perspective of a user with accessibility needs. We will share best practices, pitfalls, and a step by step guide on how to use easy UX research techniques to improve the accessibility of your application.

sessions.title: Battery Performance & Tooling
sessions.description:
Battery is the most precious resource to Android users right now. The world is more mobile, but it’s frustrating when you can’t make it through a full day without needing to recharge your phone. And Sadly, for most developers, Battery Efficiency is the last thing on their minds.

In this talk , we will introduce the basic concepts of Battery Performance on android, some tools to help you find problems, and point out a few simple pitfalls to avoid while writing your application.

sessions.title: Finding success with family-friendly apps on Play
sessions.description: Insights into the secrets of success for family-friendly apps and games on Google Play. Get practical tips directly from top partners to help you boost your reach, retention and revenue.

sessions.title: Google Cast Remote Display for games
sessions.description: There are millions of mobile devices with powerful GPUs and sensors ready to extend amazing interactive content to the largest screen in the home. Come learn how easily you can bridge the gap to the big screen in your new or existing mobile games using the new Google Cast Remote Display APIs for Android and iOS.

sessions.title: Introduction to Material Lite: Building apps quickly
sessions.description: Create beautiful interactive web apps in minutes with Material Lite components and styling.

sessions.title: Nearby: Proximity-based communication on Android and iOS
sessions.description: Collaborating, connecting, and sharing should be easier when people are together. Transitioning tasks and state across devices should be simple when devices are within arms reach. Nearby is a new, cross-platform API for discovering and communicating with devices in proximity. It fuses Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, BLE, and ultrasound to free developers from worrying about the technology. This talk will explain how to build new experiences across multiple devices.

sessions.title: Understanding your users on mobile apps with Google Analytics
sessions.description: With app discoverability being an issue, more and more developers rely on app promotion to get their app in the hands of users. With hundreds of networks to choose from, it can be difficult to keep track of and manage it all. However, with Google, you can stay on top of your app install attribution needs. In this session, we will cover how you can get started configuring campaign setup, determining where your installs came from, and sending those conversions back to the ad networks (postbacks) to optimize on them. We will also cover how you can measure the effectiveness of your marketing campaigns.

sessions.title: Designing for virtual reality
sessions.description: Designing great user experiences in virtual reality is considerably different than designing for the more traditional 2D form factors that you may be familiar with. Virtual reality introduces a new set of physiological and ergonomic considerations to your design work. Additionally, as a new medium users may not have established a familiarity with interacting with virtual reality applications yet. And with an infinite canvas inside of your application, there are some very real challenges with guiding the user’s focus and attention. We’ll review common interactive patterns for virtual reality applications that work well. We'll also discuss best practices for rapid prototyping in virtual reality, and what the Google VR design team has learned from crafting virtual reality applications.

sessions.title: Tech for a better world, faster: A fireside chat with Google.org and social innovators
sessions.description: How does an engineer, developer or computer scientist harness his or her skills to address humanity’s biggest challenges? Listen to technologists -- from Charity:water, Code for America, NexLeaf and HandUp -- who are leading innovative projects at forward-thinking nonprofit organizations supported by Google.org. They’ll share the challenges, successes, and rewards of applying technology to causes like clean water, global health, education, or increasing access for the more than three billions of people around the world facing some form of disability. You might be inspired to harness your own skills and talents toward creating a better world faster.

sessions.title: Fireside chat with Google Core engineering team
sessions.description: Google Core has been pushing the boundaries of what's possible in mobile computing for years by delivering new functionality and APIs that developers can use to build great apps. Since last Google I/O, the Google Core team has pushed five new releases, each to a billion devices. We've also made many of these services available on iOS, bringing the possible device market to 2 billion. Meet the team that makes this possible, understand the objectives behind Google Core and the alignment between iOS and Android.

sessions.title: How to create apps that families love
sessions.description: Kids today are consuming technology like never before, and parents are supporting this habit. Find out the key elements of designing high-quality apps for families and kids, directly from Google and top developers in this space. This talk will discuss best practices for creating great family-friendly user experiences, how to appeal to parents with features that kids like, and optimizing user interface design for children.

sessions.title: Introduction to high-performance NDK Audio
sessions.description: Android is now ready for serious audio and music applications. This session will introduce creating high-performance, low-latency audio generation applications in C/C++ with the Android NDK. We will cover creating an NDK application project in Eclipse, OpenSL ES audio playback and an architecture for audio synthesis applications.

sessions.title: Lovefield
sessions.description: Lovefield is an open-source, cross-browser relational database management system written in JavaScript. It is fast, easy-to-use, and helps shaping offline-capable web apps. It provides expressive SQL-like query capabilities which bridge the gap created by WebSQL deprecation. In this talk, we will demonstrate how to use Lovefield to help with developer's offline-first web apps.

sessions.title: Material Design on iOS + web: Engineering across platforms
sessions.description: Engineering material design across platforms.

sessions.title: Promote your mobile app in minutes
sessions.description: Promote your app directly from the Google Play Developer Console. In a matter of minutes, launch a campaign that reaches users across Google Search, AdMob, Play, YouTube, and more. Come by this session to learn tips on developing creatives, bidding and reporting to maximize reach and engagement for your apps.

sessions.title: Reach more gamers by going local
sessions.description: Connect with the next billion players by going local. Google, as a platform, has unprecedented reach all over the world, but developers often don't know where to start. Building the best user experiences, one market at a time, is a great strategy to expand globally.

sessions.title: Smarter approaches to app testing
sessions.description: One of the reasons over a billion users love Android is that they get to pick the device that's just right for them. This can make it harder to test on all of your users’ devices before release. Apps that are tested thoroughly get better reviews and make more money (fact!). We're here to help – hear about the new ways Google can help maximize the success of your next app launch with cheaper and easier testing strategies.

sessions.title: Your app, now available hands-free
sessions.description:
Mobile hardware has adopted the touch screen as the primary mode of input. And with 1 billion active Android users, there’s no sign of this slowing down.

What if you could provide users with a new method of access to your apps with little to no development overhead?

In this talk, we introduce Voice Access, a service that gives anyone access to their Android device through voice alone. We will focus on simple steps developers can follow to ensure that Voice Access provides an optimal experience within their apps.

sessions.title: Android Backup in Google Drive
sessions.description: We’ve all been there: You set up a shiny new device, but your apps don’t carry over properly from your old phone to your new one. Now there’s an answer. The Android “M” release ships with full data cloud backup in Google Drive, so now all of the user data associated with an app (“AppData”) will be backed up and restored. This talk will show you how to set this up in your own apps, and will demo several scenarios with popular apps that “just work” out of the box after a restore. This seamless full-data backup creates an awesome user experience and maximizes user adoption of your apps even when transitioning to a new device.

sessions.title: App discovery on Google Play
sessions.description: We've made progress over the last year towards better personalization on Play’s homepages, via innovative user experiences and advanced technologies such as Google Brain and Google-scale distributed machine learning. In this talk, we provide an overview of how we model user tastes and interests, how we recommend apps and games you will love, and how to occasionally take educated guesses on content we've never shown you before. We also talk about new immersive experiences that’ll help the user engage with the store as a habit and hence discover more apps.

sessions.title: Applying Wear design patterns
sessions.description: A very detailed and thorough look at the new Material Design patterns for Android Wear apps: When should you be an app versus a notification or contextual card? What patterns are right for what tasks/apps? How to mix and match?

sessions.title: GCM Cross Platform
sessions.description: How to smartly use GCM push messaging to reach your users: Revisit User device group notification and introduce new Topic device group notification

sessions.title: Get your app into the Google index
sessions.description: Learn the steps involved in making sure a mobile app can be indexed by Google and appear in Google Search results and Search autocompletions. This talk will show how App Indexing can help you get new users, drive re-engagement, and measure the results.

sessions.title: Google Classroom demo
sessions.description: Check out what's possible with Google Classroom, which launched a year ago and is being used by millions of teachers and students.

sessions.title: Improving urban mobility by connecting citizens
sessions.description: Waze launched the Connected Citizens Program in October 2014 with 10 cities around the world. Now, at 30 cities, law enforcement and Departments of Transportation, we have data on the impact of massively crowdsourced data on our traffic patterns. We’ll share case studies and look at the real ways they’re improving their cities to meet citizen expectations in a mobile world.

sessions.title: Offline apps with Polymer and Service Worker
sessions.description: What happens when your users try to return to your web app while offline? The answer is probably that they see a default browser error page. Now, with new, standardized web platform features, you can control this experience, maybe even providing the full value of your app while offline. In this talk, learn how service workers make great offline experiences possible, and how Polymer makes it easy.

sessions.title: Permissions model for new applications
sessions.description: Android M is going to change the Permissions model for new applications. This is the first change to how Android deals with permissions since its inception. Developers need to understand what's changing, how it impacts them, and how to continue giving users a great experience while maintaining privacy.

sessions.title: Recommendations with Android TV
sessions.description: Content Recommendations enable your app's content to be placed front and center on the Android TV Home Screen. This talk will cover guidelines for creating relevant, actionable recommendations and preview new APIs that will assist in their development and deployment on Android TV.

sessions.title: Firebase: An Overview
sessions.description: Firebase is the fastest way to build your app. Come and learn how you can build applications quickly without managing complex infrastructure. Find out how Firebase's data storage, user management, and asset hosting features work and learn about other brand new features we're unveiling too.

sessions.title: Helping Moonshots Survive Contact with the Real World
sessions.description: Venture inside Google[x] for an in-depth conversation with Astro Teller, Captain of Moonshots, who will discuss one of the hardest parts of the innovation process -- the part where you come into contact with the real world, and learn what’s wrong with what you’ve done so far. He’ll explain why failure is so important to the innovation process at Google[x], and how we relentlessly seek out contact with the harsh realities of weather, physics, humanity, and much more, because so much of what we have to learn can’t be predicted by a book, taught in school or observed in a lab. He'll illustrate this by sharing hard-earned lessons from Project Loon, the self-driving car, Makani and more.

sessions.title: Android Battery Life
sessions.description: Battery life is #1 problem in Mobile. Objectives: Developers understand the collective problem; Developers understand the tools available to characterize the battery impact of their apps; Developers understand the features in Android to help with battery life; Developers understand the new battery related platform behaviors that will affect their apps

sessions.title: Building location aware apps using the Android Location and Places APIs
sessions.description: When we talk about meeting up for lunch, we don’t think of location as latitude and longitude - we think of a place, like a restaurant or cafe. The Places API makes using location in Android more powerful by providing APIs to accurately determine and communicate about the place or semantic location that a device is currently at, powered by Google's best in class local business data. This talk introduces the new features available for representing location as part of the API, and the practical applications of this API.

sessions.title: Containers to back your mobile app
sessions.description: Your mobile backend APIs need to be simple, reliable, and ready to scale when your usebase does. In this talk we'll walk you through setting up very flexible API using containers on Google Cloud Platform.

sessions.title: Gaming on Android TV
sessions.description: Android is in the living room, through Android TV. Players are finding that their familiar consumer electronics devices, from cable boxes, to media players, to televisions, now give them easy access to great games. With the Nearby Connections API we introduced at GDC, developers can now bring second screen experiences to Android TV too. This talk discusses how to easily adapt games to Android TV.

sessions.title: Grow your app user base with Search
sessions.description: Google Search for Developers will help you get more users and keep them engaged with your app or website. Google Search helps increase your Android app installs and site usage by making your content stand out to users. Search also brings you users looking for answers and actions like playing a song. This talk covers App Indexing, Voice Actions, Structured Data, and Search Console.

sessions.title: Grow your app via word of mouth
sessions.description: The leading problem app developers face is to get users to discover their app in an extraordinarily competitive and crowded market. In this talk, we will present best practices for developers to drive organic growth via word-of-mouth, and how Google can help them.

sessions.title: Leanback support library
sessions.description: Android TV presents unique opportunities for developers to create a living room presence for their applications and services. Delivering a delightful experience for TVs requires consideration of distance, form factor, and input, but it doesn't have to be difficult! Come learn about the Leanback support library, designed for rapid development of TV UX through customizable fragments and templates. We will present a broad overview of features, and highlight upcoming visual changes and new features.

sessions.title: Smarter and personalized device authentication with Smart Lock
sessions.description: Join us to learn how we’ve made Android even smarter so you can securely and conveniently keep your phone unlocked using a new set of exciting technologies from biometrics to wearables. If you’re a wearable manufacturer, find out how you can make your wearable compatible.

sessions.title: The Physical Web: Interaction is Just a Tap Away
sessions.description:
If we believe in Moore's Law whatsoever, then small, cheap, connected devices will soon explode into our lives, filling our homes, workplaces, and public spaces. Today, most IoT devices require installing a dedicated app, which simply doesn't scale when you want to interact with a multitude of smart “things” around you every day.

The web is a natural fit, offering interaction on demand without the friction and overhead of installation. This talk introduces the Physical Web, a technology that lets you walk up and use anything with just a tap.

sessions.title: Using Ambiactive in wearable apps
sessions.description: Ambiactive (ambient-active) is a new feature of the Android Wear platform that allows long-running applications to control the entire screen in low-power ambient mode (with a lower refresh rate, in black and white). Previously, when the watch entered low-power mode, it returned to the home screen, exiting the currently running application. In this talk we will describe how to update the long-running activities in your application to implement ambiactive mode to preserve application state and continually present ongoing updates, while conserving battery.

sessions.title: Achieving Maps zen on Android
sessions.description: Do your maps look the same as everyone elses? Is your user experience a bit ho hum? Android maps veterans Chris and Ankur will enlighten you on the zen patterns that bring maps feng shui to your Android apps.

sessions.title: AdMob Cross-platform Showdown
sessions.description: It's an epic battle between two AdMob engineers, one on Android and one on iOS! They will battle for the title of Fastest Ad in the West as they live code their way into stardom. Join our mystery celebrity host and their swag cannon to an action packed coding session.

sessions.title: Make Believe
sessions.description: Join us to explore virtual reality and how it may change our lives. Learn how it works and how to design virtual reality experiences. Includes lessons learnt from virtual reality game developer Katie Goode.

sessions.title: Rendering Performance & Tooling
sessions.description:
Rendering performance is all about how fast you can draw your activity, and get it updated on the screen. Success here means your users feeling like your application is smooth and responsive, which means that you’ve got to get all your logic completed, _and_ all your rendering done in 16ms or less, each and every frame. But that might be a bit more difficult than you think.

In this talk,we will take a look at what “rendering performance” means, alongside some of the most common pitfalls that are ran into; and let’s not forget the important stuff: the tools that help you track down, and fix these issues before they become large problems.

sessions.title: Simplifying app development using the wearable support library
sessions.description: The wearable support library provides extra functionality used by Android Wear developers to develop great wearable experiences. It includes common user interface components that developers can use to support round and square watches, notification cards, long press to dismiss, countdowns, confirmations, 2D pickers, and selection lists. Come to the talk to find out more about how to use the wearable support library, and how you can use it to simplify your Android Wear development.

sessions.title: The world as a dataset
sessions.description: Satellite imagery has the potential to be a powerful tool for global business analytics and global transparency. However, the vast majority of high-resolution imagery today is updated infrequently. What if it were updated weekly? Daily? Recent and timely data could be used by analysts, operational managers, data scientists, and developers to increase the efficiency, profitability, safety, and transparency of organizations around the world. Take a look under the hood at Skybox to find out what we're building for your business and get a preview of a new breed of dataset.

sessions.title: Using the Fitness platform on wearable devices
sessions.description: We'd like to demonstrate how to use the Google Fitness platform APIs to read activity history and write activity sessions, with a particular focus on wearable devices: displaying step counts, fitness goals, and progress on a watch face, and recording exercise activities on a wearable.

sessions.title: Video chat for Web, iOS and Android
sessions.description: WebRTC enables realtime audio, video and data communication on billions of clients across Web, Android and iOS. In this talk, you will learn how to build a high performance, cross-platform voice and video chat application.

sessions.title: What's new in the Google Play Developer Console
sessions.description: Google Play’s new launches will help you acquire more users and improve the quality of your app. Come and hear an overview of the latest features and how you can start taking advantage of them in the Developer Console.

sessions.title: Ignite
sessions.description: Ignite is a series of five-minute presentations for geeks. Each speaker gets 20 slides that auto-advance after 15 seconds. Come prepared to for rapid-fire ideas from all over the world.

sessions.title: Accessible Web Components
sessions.description: “You should be writing accessible Web Components, but are you really?” Cover why a11y is so extremely important for Web Components. Go over a11y checklist and implement a few elements live.

sessions.title: Deep Dive: Overview Cards API
sessions.description: Deep Dive: Overview Cards API

sessions.title: Designing for Driving
sessions.description: Android Auto was developed to take features and apps from your phone and deliver them in a responsible manner for use in your car. This is a challenging process and there’s a lot of research and reason that goes into every part the interface in order to help minimize driver distraction. This talk steps through some of the work that Google does to drive the design of Android Auto.

sessions.title: Expressing brand in Material
sessions.description: Anyone should be able to incorporate the material design framework while maintaining a strong brand identity. Whether it’s a custom font, a unique color story, or distinct voice, everything that provides stylistic distinction in a product should be celebrated and supported in the material design framework. We’ve laid out the top brand touchpoints to consider illustrate the system’s flexibility and give designers and developers a road map for showcasing their brand identity.

sessions.title: Finding your way with the Google Maps SDK for iOS
sessions.description: Have you ever wanted your users to be able to share where they are with each other, or where they want to go? The Google Maps SDK for iOS, with the addition of Places API for iOS, enables your users to find that perfect Sushi place or a cozy coffee shop with confidence. The Google Places API brings the power of one of the most comprehensive locations databases to your app, and the Google Maps SDK for iOS puts effortless geographic visualisation in the palm of your hand.

sessions.title: Fireside chat with Google Core engineering team
sessions.description: Google Core has been pushing the boundaries of what's possible in mobile computing for years by delivering new functionality and APIs that developers can use to build great apps. Since last Google I/O, the Google Core team has pushed five new releases, each to a billion devices. We've also made many of these services available on iOS, bringing the possible device market to 2 billion. Meet the team that makes this possible, understand the objectives behind Google Core and the alignment between iOS and Android.

sessions.title: Making your apps work smarter: Introducing Google’s beacon platform and Eddystone, a new open beacon format
sessions.description:
No omnipresent tool in history has ever had as much computing power or as many sensors as the modern smartphone. Yet, we’re still struggling to harness and contextualize this opportunity into more intuitive interactions: why doesn’t my transit app automatically detect my current stop? Why doesn’t my fitness app understand I was on a stationary bike?

Join us to hear how we’re beginning to use beacons to enable smarter interactions based on precise context: expanding the conversation from inferring context to creating context, and from mapping the world to marking it up. This talk introduces Google’s beacon platform, and Eddystone, a new open BLE beacon format, designed to make beacon development and deployment easier for everyone.

sessions.title: Memory Performance & Tooling
sessions.description:
What’s great about Android’s runtime that most of the stress of memory reclamation is done for you; The system will track what you’re doing, and when it sees an object isn’t needed any more, will free it on your behalf. While this is great for your general health, and blood pressure, this doesn’t exclude performance problems from happening here.

In this talk, we will walk through how the Android memory system works, and identifies some common perf problems, and introduce you to tools to help track down and solve the issues.

sessions.title: Optimizing your game’s first impression on Play
sessions.description: Google Play offers developers an incredible opportunity to reach more than 1 billion people in 190 countries. App discovery and distribution play a critical role in driving developers’ success. Learn from the Dots team on how they leveraged Google Play’s features to optimize their visual assets for increased discovery and distribution of their games.

sessions.title: A preview of what’s in-store for payments
sessions.description: Come join us and get a sneak peak into what we’re working on for in-store payments, where your identity and phone work in tandem to deliver a seamless payment experience.

sessions.title: Android Testing Support Library
sessions.description: The Android Testing Support Library is a collection of tools for testing Android apps. This talk will introduce key parts of ATSL (namely test runner and rules, as well as Espresso) and demonstrate how they can be used to author and execute a set of simple tests that can run in a device or an emulator.

sessions.title: Android for Work Update
sessions.description: Android M is bringing the power of Android to all kinds of workplaces. This opens huge new markets for hundreds of millions of devices to workers at small business, deskless workers, logistics and warehousing jobs; all be empowered by adoption of Android devices at Work.

sessions.title: Apps installing channels on TVs
sessions.description: Box talk for Android TV engineering team to showcase/explain/workshop the concept of apps being able to install channels on TVs and how it fits into the TV scheme. We'd probably have engineering explain how to go about building/implmenting at a high-level.

sessions.title: GCM Cross Platform
sessions.description: How to smartly use GCM push messaging to reach your users: Revisit User device group notification and introduce new Topic device group notification

sessions.title: Mobilizing the Maps Data APIs
sessions.description: Geo web services let developers create compelling location based apps on mobile, such as snapping your car’s location to roads, auto-completing an address, or displaying directions from A to B on a map. This talk will tackle several challenges that developers face in working with web services for mobile, in particular key security, how to share context between different APIs and conserving battery life.

sessions.title: New monetization opportunities in Google Play for Education
sessions.description: Google Play for Education offers developers a channel for reaching schools using Android tablets and Chromebooks. Learn how Google is making it easier for schools to discover and evaluate great digital content and how you can build apps that support new monetization mechanisms through Google Play for Education.

sessions.title: Optimizing graphics memory bandwidth on mobile GPUs
sessions.description: High-quality graphics rendering can help your game stand out and keep players immersed and engaged. But particularly on mobile devices, performance of advanced multi-pass techniques like deferred shading or post-processing are usually limited by bandwidth. This talk demonstrates how to use new features coming to Android's native graphics API to keep intermediate data in fast on-chip memory between passes, saving valuable bandwidth and power while increasing performance.

sessions.title: What's next with Project Tango?
sessions.description: It's been almost a year since we unveiled Project Tango. If you are a mobile developer interested in creating location-aware and spatial experiences, come learn about the new tools we've created for you and see what our partners have built. Get a sneak peak at how Project Tango will help users connect the virtual world with the real world. Join us on our journey!

sessions.title: Developers connecting the world through Google Play
sessions.description: Back in the 90s, there were early glimpses of a dream to connect the whole world through the internet. However, it seemed unrealistic during an era of desktop computers, dial-up modems, and mouse-and-keyboard interaction. Today, that dream is actually starting to come true, through mobile and apps. In this session, you'll see how the new mobile ecosystem including Google Play and Android are empowering developers to make good on the dream of connecting the world through technology to improve people's lives.

sessions.title: Developing for the living room with Google
sessions.description: The living room ecosystem and its 1.5 billion TVs are exploding with new entertainment and new forms of interactivity. With the tremendous growth of Google Cast and Android TV devices, building engaging living room experiences has never been easier or more important. Whether you’re building applications to deliver media, live tv or a multi-screen game, come join us as we discuss how to build a great TV application, get it discovered, and how to engage users in the five hours a day that people spend in front of their TV.

sessions.title: Unlock your app’s potential with accessibility
sessions.description: When you make your app accessible, you don’t just open it up to the billion people worldwide who live with a disability. You get a better product for all of your users. This talk will inspire you to make accessibility a priority in your app’s development.
